metadata.title: CVE-2023-1855 on Ubuntu 22.04 FIPS Compliant (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in xgene_hwmon_remove indrivers/hwmon/xgene-hwmon.c in the Hardware Monitoring Linux Kernel Driver(xgene-hwmon). This flaw could allow a local attacker to crash the systemdue to a race problem. This vulnerability could even lead to a kernelinformation leak problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1855` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-79-generic - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-5.15.0-79-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-79-generic - 5.15.0-79.86
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-79-generic-64k - 5.15.0-79.86
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-79.86').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
